items.title: Photoshop in the browser is now a reality.
items.content:
Frontend Focus

#‚Äã514 ‚Äî October 27, 2021 | Read on the web

A Deep Dive into object-fit and background‚Äësize in CSS ‚Äî Goes through just how object-fit and background-size work, when to use them, and why, along with some practical use cases and¬†recommendations.

Ahmad Shadeed

Photoshop's Journey to the Web ‚Äî Just the idea of running software as complex as Photoshop directly in the browser would have been hard to imagine even just a few years ago, but here we are: Thanks to new standardized web technologies, Adobe has now brought a public beta of Photoshop to the¬†web. This opens up a lot of potential not just for Adobe but anyone with lofty browser-based¬†ambitions.

Thomas Nattestad & Nabeel Al-Shamma

Walkthrough of an Easy Angular Data Grid with Examples ‚Äî You could write your own data grid, but why would you when this one already exists. See how easy it is to set up, bind data, group, sort, page, and more. Fiddle with the live samples or install it and try it for yourself, but don‚Äôt miss¬†it.

Progress Kendo UI for Angular sponsor

New HTTP Standards for Caching on the Modern Web ‚Äî Caching static content via a CDN or similar service is important, particularly for large sites, but can often be complicated and confusing. This post looks at new HTTP standards that are hoping to make this better, how they work, and why you should¬†care.

Tim Perry

The Start of a New Era for Responsive Web Design ‚Äî After designing for fixed screens, and then responsively, the author proposes we‚Äôre entering an era of ‚Äòcomponent driven‚Äô design.

Francois Brill

New WebKit Features in Safari 15 ‚Äî A look at the new features available with the release of Safari 15.1, including aspect-ratio, CSS Grid Inspector, ES6 Modules in Workers and ServiceWorkers, WebGL2 and¬†more.

Jen Simmons

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • The hugely valuable Wayback Machine project from the Internet Archive got started 20-years ago this week.
  • Reminder: The State of CSS survey for 2021 is now open and seeking your response.
  • New material has been added to Google's Learn CSS course, including how to take advantage of CSS properties like ::marker and list-style.
  • As Lea points out here, the web probably needs its own Emoji picker.
  • A smart Web developer created a fake VS Code-esque Web page to keep an eye on the cricket scores.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Prevent Scroll Chaining with Overscroll Behaviour ‚Äî Looks at the overscroll-behavior CSS property, what problem it solves, how it works, and where we can use¬†it.

Ahmad Shadeed

Building a Multi-Select Component ‚Äî A foundational overview of how to build a responsive, adaptive, and accessible, multiselect component for sort and filter user¬†experiences.

Adam Argyle

How Not To Create a Menu Burger Button ‚Äî A collection of bad practices in HTML - looking at menu buttons patterns, copied from real¬†websites.

Manuel Matuzoviƒá

Why 'Outdated' jQuery Is Still the Dominant JavaScript Library ‚Äî jQuery is one of the longest running and most influential JavaScript libraries on the web. How has it stood the test of¬†time?

Richard MacManus

‚ÄúA staggering 78% of the top 1 million websites use jQuery in some way, according to BuiltWith.‚Äù

___
Richard MacManus

"Dark Mode" vs "Inverted" ‚Äî An approach to help clarify the difference between ‚Äúdark mode‚Äù and ‚Äúcomponents rendered on a dark background‚Äù within your design¬†system.

Brad Frost

Building An Effective Image Component ‚Äî An out-of-the-box solution to optimize images for Next.js. It optimizes loading, compression & responsiveness. Now with AVIF support in Next.js¬†12.

Sohoni, Erickson, Castle

Shortcut Puts the Agile in Agile and the ‚ÄúCan‚Äù in Kanban

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

In-Page Filtered Search with Vanilla JavaScript

Hilman Ramadhan

100 Bytes of CSS to Look Great Everywhere

Shaun Wang

Expandable Sections Within a CSS Grid

Kev Bonett

Jobs

Work From Anywhere in the World: Remote Sr. Front-End Engineer ‚Äî B2B SaaS company seeks engineers who love building interactive data apps, being a part of a global community, and great hot¬†sauce.
Chili Piper

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.
Hired

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

Huetone: Use The LCH Color Space to Come Up with Predictable and Accessible Color Palettes ‚Äî The creator explains the tool in detail in this Twitter¬†thread.

alexey ardov

Box Shadow Generator: A Visual Tool to Generate Code for CSS Box Shadows ‚Äî You can choose from a gallery of predefined box shadow settings or create and customize your¬†own.

Andrei Surdu

Free Activity Feeds & Chat APIs for Qualifying Teams ‚Äî Unlock enterprise-grade features, functions, and UI components completely free for your startup or side project with the Maker Account from¬†Stream.

Stream sponsor

Blobity: Level Up Your Cursor Game ‚Äî This script and API lets you do all sorts of creative things with the user‚Äôs cursor, which the page itself demonstrates ‚Äî the demo is similar to how the cursor on iPad OS works. Note that it‚Äôs free for open-source projects¬†only.

Georgy Marchuk

Image Compressor: Compress & Optimize JPEG and PNG¬†Images ‚Äî Yet another option for doing manual image compression. This one lets you upload multiple images and includes optional tools for resizing, converting, and¬†mirroring.

NAZRUL ISLAM

üçì Do you work with the Jamstack (that's a JavaScript, API and Markup architecture stack)? If so, you may enjoy Brian Rinaldi's JAMstacked, it's a fortnightly round-up covering the growing and rapidly evolving Jamstack ecosystem. Here's a little taste of the sorts of things shared in the latest issue:

Want to give it a try?
Tap here to subscribe
  • Matt Biilmann of Netlify discusses some key concepts that will impact the future of Jamstack with folks like Evan You, Rich Harris and more - from the recent Jamstack Conf.
  • It's often assumed that Jamstack or a serverless architecture are basically one and the same. This post from Colby Fayock breaks down the difference and shows how both can be combined.
  • Raymond Camden looks at the upgrade experience for Eleventy 1.0 (still in beta).

items.title: Web Components: Superpowers for HTML?
items.content:
Frontend Focus

#‚Äã513 ‚Äî October 20, 2021 | Read on the web

‚ñ∂¬†¬†HTML with Superpowers ‚Äî A 45-minute talk all about Web Components, covering how to use them, style them with CSS, and build them with JavaScript. Dave adds that now browser support is widespread ‚Äúthey‚Äôre worth¬†investigating‚Äù.

Dave Rupert

‚ñ∂¬†¬†What's New in Chrome 95 for Developers ‚Äî Chrome 95 is rolling out starting today. Here, Pete LePage runs through what to expect, including easier routing with the baked-in URLPattern API, the Eye Dropper API (providing a built in tool for selecting colors), and¬†more. Here's a look at what version 95 brings to Chrome's DevTools.

Chrome Developers

Power Up Your JavaScript with Functional Programming ‚Äî Learn core functional JS programming techniques by coding with pure functions, learning recursion, higher-order functions, closures, currying, function composition, and¬†more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

An Interview With Elad Shechter on "The New CSS Reset" ‚Äî Chris Coyier chats with Elad Shechter to discuss his reset strategy and how it‚Äôs evolved over the last few years following the addition of new CSS¬†features.

CSS Tricks

Fix Web Accessibility Systematically ‚Äî To address web accessibility properly, we must address the whole system on how we develop and use the technologies that build the¬†web.

Eric Eggert

The Art of Deception, Lighthouse Score Edition ‚Äî Yes, you can game your Lighthouse score, but no, you shouldn‚Äôt ‚Äî it really helps no one. As such, here are four things to be aware of, and tips for keeping things balanced.

Zach Leatherman

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • A U.S. governor is seeking criminal prosecution for a reporter who looked at the HTML source code of a webpage, confusing the act as one of a 'hacker'.
  • Just in case you are wondering where it's gone, the handy 'CSS Overview' panel in Chrome (Canary) has moved out of the experiments area.
  • Here's a solid overview of what's new in version 2.2 of Web Content Accessibility Guidelines ‚Äî expected to release next year.
  • Brave Search is now the default in the Brave Browser, replacing Google.
  • Yeah, the new MacBook Pro's have a notch, so erm, why not add one to your site too. üôÉ

Jobs

Frontend Developer at X-Team (Remote) ‚Äî Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, and¬†more.
X-Team

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.
Hired

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Smart CSS Solutions for Common UI Challenges ‚Äî A look at some common user interface problems and use cases we all may face, and how to solve them with modern¬†CSS.

Cosima Mielke

What If‚Ä¶ You Could Use Visual Studio Code as the Editor of In-Browser Developer Tools? ‚Äî The next version of Microsoft Edge will feature an experiment that allows you to use Visual Studio Code as the editor of the in-browser Developer Tools. There's also a quick video showing off why this may be a good¬†idea.

Christian Heilmann

Real World Use Case: Using Angular to Quickly Modernize Fiddler ‚Äî Kendo UI for Angular helped improve UX and bring the popular tool to more platforms in impressive time. Quick¬†read.

Progress Kendo UI for Angular sponsor

Buttons vs. Links: No, They Are Not The Same ‚Äî Should some links look like buttons, or should some buttons look like links? Let‚Äôs take a look to see what these two UI elements are and what they do, and then, how they can¬†look.

Eric Eggert

The Button Cheat Sheet ‚Äî Need a button in your latest project but unsure on markup? This cheat sheet should¬†help.

Manuel Matuzoviƒá

'CSS is Going Gosh-Darned Hog Wild, I Tell Ya What' ‚Äî Chris rounds up some of the latest changes and additions to¬†CSS.

CSS Tricks

‚ÄúAs someone just sittin‚Äô back watching CSS evolve, it feels like we‚Äôre at one of the hottest moments of innovation in CSS history.‚Äù

___
Chris Coyier

Detecting Specific Text Input with HTML and CSS ‚Äî A series of HTML and CSS tricks to detect text input and display a ‚Äòsecret message‚Äô to the¬†user.

Louis Lazaris

How It Feels to Code an HTML Email Template in 2021 ‚Äî It's worth noting this is very much a tongue-in-cheek piece!

Stoil Stoychev

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

What The Tag: Quickly Find Out Which HTML Tag to Use When ‚Äî A simple interactive tool where you answer questions to determine which HTML element to use. You might also like Can I Include, which deals with proper nesting of HTML¬†elements.

Benjamin Holfve

Imgsrc.space: Get Image and Video Placeholders Right From Code, Fast ‚Äî This placeholder service uses a script inserted via a CDN, then you just add images or videos with the specified syntax in the img/video¬†tags.

Imgsrc.space

Wavy Divider Generator: Generate Code for 'Wavy' HTML/CSS Dividers ‚Äî You can pick one of the already defined wavy dividers, then customize the color, shape, and position of the ‚Äúwaves‚Äù.

Eugene Zolotarenko

Shortcut Puts the Agile in Agile and the ‚ÄúCan‚Äù in Kanban

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

Accessible Palette: Online Tool to Create Color Systems with Consistent Lightness and Contrast

Eugene Fedorenko

LittleJS: A Tiny 2D JavaScript Game Engine with Fast WebGL¬†Rendering ‚Äî No dependencies and it claims to render 10,000+ objects at¬†60fps.

Frank Force

OpenSilver 1.0: A Modern, Plugin-Free Reimplementation of Silverlight ‚Äî This is a replacement for Microsoft‚Äôs lonnnng deprecated Silverlight technology, but as of this 1.0 release boasts being ‚Äúpowerful enough to run complex line-of-business applications of all sizes‚Äù. It‚Äôs open-source and runs in current browsers via¬†WebAssembly.

Userware

The Classic FPS 'DOOM' Rendered via HTML Checkboxes ‚Äî Is it possible to play DOOM in your browser using nothing but checkboxes for rendering? Yes! Sure, it‚Äôs not going to be your first choice, but it‚Äôs fun to see it done, and here‚Äôs the¬†source.

Andrew Healey

items.title: The State of CSS survey returns
items.content:
Frontend Focus

#‚Äã512 ‚Äî October 13, 2021 | Read on the web

The State of CSS Survey ‚Äî This year's State of CSS survey is now open. It's well worth taking a few minutes to fill it out and share your thoughts. The results will highlight the latest CSS trends, and always makes for an interesting read. Last year reiterated the rise of Grid, how more folks are using VS Code, and just how little love Print stylesheets get. Sacha outlines what's new in this year's questionnaire here.

Rapha√´l Benitte & Sacha Greif

The Case for 'Developer Experience' ‚Äî In a world of ‚Äòno code‚Äô, SaaS, and APIs, Jean presents a considered take on the evolving developer experience, and embracing the messy reality of the tech¬†stack.

Jean Yang

Consent Management Without Endless Configurations ‚Äî Transcend Consent ensures nothing is tracked without user consent, without sacrificing site performance or UX. The only solution that is fully compliant across all 200+ tracking technologies ‚Äì all in a lightweight, 30KB¬†bundle.

Transcend sponsor

RenderingNG: An Architecture That Makes and Keeps Chrome Fast for The Long Term ‚Äî Highlights the long-term rendering journey of Chrome over the past eight¬†years.

Chris Harrelson (Google)

How to Win at CORS ‚Äî Jake, developer advocate at Google, outlines all he knows about Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) in an effort to help make sense of things. There‚Äôs a demo/playground here to help illustrate¬†things.

Jake Archibald

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • It's been 27 years since the first proposal of 'Cascading HTML style sheets' was published.
  • Microsoft have tweaked how Edge processes show up in Windows Task Manager. These look to be some rather handy changes.
  • Adobe is alleged to have used the DMCA to shut down a project that's aiming to keep Flash alive.
  • Here's a look at 13 'tiny and terrific' entries from the recent Js13kGames competition. These are always fascinating.
  • Halloween is coming, as such here's a dozen spooky looking fonts ‚Äî should you have a need.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Safe DOM Manipulation (in the Future) with the Sanitizer API ‚Äî The new Sanitizer API (edited by developers from both Google and Mozilla) aims to build a robust processor for arbitrary strings to be safely inserted into a page. Something to look forward¬†to.

Jack J (Google)

Myths About Web Accessibility ‚Äî A collection debunking some common web accessibility misconceptions or myths (such as accessibility being difficult, expensive, etc).

Alvaro Montoro

Shortcut Puts the Agile in Agile and the ‚ÄúCan‚Äù in Kanban ‚Äî Shortcut is made for developers and PMs, providing speedy task management, reporting, and collaboration. Try it¬†today.

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

My Challenge to the Web Performance Community ‚Äî A subtle set of guidelines for how we talk about web performance¬†optimizations.

Philip Walton

Practical Frontend Philosophy ‚Äî General thoughts on how to think about frontend development: ‚ÄúZoomed out, the frontend is just a data pipeline, conveying data from computers to¬†humans‚Äù.

Jared Gorski

The Autofill Dark Pattern ‚Äî Explores how different browsers implement the autofill feature, allowing for a dark pattern that lets developers get users‚Äô personal data without their¬†permission.

Alvaro Montoro

How to Create a CSS Typewriter Effect ‚Äî I think this effect can be a little overdone, but this is a particularly simple way to pull it¬†off.

Using Modern Image Formats: AVIF and WebP ‚Äî Highlights how modern image formats (such as AVIF or WebP) can improve compression by up to 50% and deliver better quality per-byte while still looking visually appealing. Compares what‚Äôs possible at high-quality, low-quality and file-size¬†targets.

Proposal for CSS @when ‚Äî The CSS Working Group recently resolved to adopt a proposal for adding when/else rules ‚Äî this sorta stuff will make handling complex media queries much easier to cope¬†with.

Chris Coyier

A Guide to CSS Debugging ‚Äî Debugging in CSS means figuring out what might be the problem when you have unexpected layout results. This post looks at a few categories that bugs often fit into, how to evaluate the situation when you find some, and explore techniques that help prevent such¬†bugs.

Stephanie Eckles

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • Yep, Facebook (along with Instagram and WhatsApp) suffered a major outage earlier this week ‚Äî¬†this post from Cloudflare attempts to dig into what happened.
  • This article from Matthias Ott is a few years old now, but following Facebook's outage this week, it's still an apt reminder to have a corner of the internet to call your own (preaching to the converted here no doubt).
  • Starting with version 93, Firefox will monitor available system memory and, should it ever become critically low, will respond by unloading memory-heavy but not actively used tabs.
  • Following changes in Windows 11 both Brave and Firefox will intercept links that force-open in Microsoft Edge.
  • Here's a quick comic from Julia Evans explaining cross-origin resource requests (aka CORS).
  • Google has dropped support for IE11 in its core search experience ‚Äì users will now get a 'fallback experience' instead.
